content:
This modifies the _style_ linter to add an option to autofix style problems instead of just complaining.
The intended application is twofold:

  • Let users run this (manually or maybe even as a git hook) before pushing so their build doesn't fail on the style step
  • Maybe allow people to configure their editor to suggest/autofix such issues as they time
  • Let CI automatically suggest these fixes (demoed in #6569), so if people make a push and then switch branches it is easy to update the orignal PR. This is something we can hopefully leverage more widely in future to reduce turnaround on PRs with trivial issues

The main caveat is that it is currently quite basic, it won't reflow lines or anything fancy, but it will delete disallowed set_options change lower . to middle Â· and remove spaces before semicolons, in exactly situations where the linter complained before.
The other issue is that it is written in python still and would be nicer if rewritten in lean as that may allow some parts to be migrated to the actual linter framework, but hopefully this is still a useful intermediate step.
But I'll wait a little bit to see if others have some comments.
